skill.name: research-lookup
skill.description: Look up current research information using Perplexity's Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro models through OpenRouter. Automatically selects the best model based on query complexity. Search academic papers, recent studies, technical documentation, and general research information with citations.
skill.summary: Look up current research information using Perplexity's Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro mode...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Legitimate research lookup skill. Makes API calls to OpenRouter for Perplexity Sonar models. Reads OPENROUTER_API_KEY for authentication. No suspicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Look up current research papers and citations
content.value_statement: Finding relevant academic papers and research citations takes significant time. This skill searches academic databases and scholarly sources automatically, returning structured results with proper citations and source links.
actual_capabilities: Search academic papers and scholarly sources via Perplexity Sonar models
Auto-select between fast lookup (Pro Search) and deep analysis (Reasoning Pro)
Extract citations with DOI links, authors, titles, journals, and publication years
Filter results by recency and prioritize peer-reviewed sources
Process batch queries for literature review workflows
limitations: Requires OPENROUTER_API_KEY with Perplexity model access
May miss very recent papers not yet indexed in search databases

use_cases.title: Literature review assistance
use_cases.description: Find and cite recent papers on specific research topics with automatic citation extraction.

use_cases.title: Background research gathering
use_cases.description: Gather supporting evidence and sources for manuscripts, grant proposals, and technical documents.

use_cases.title: Paper discovery
use_cases.description: Locate relevant academic sources for coursework, theses, and research projects.

prompt_templates.title: Find recent papers
prompt_templates.scenario: Search for papers on a specific topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Find recent academic papers on [TOPIC] published in 2024. Include citations with authors, journal, year, and DOI.

prompt_templates.title: Compare methods
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare and contrast [METHOD A] versus [METHOD B] for [APPLICATION]. Include key studies and citations.

prompt_templates.title: Explain mechanism
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the mechanism of [PHENOMENON] and find supporting research papers with citations.

prompt_templates.title: Systematic review
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a comprehensive search for studies on [TOPIC]. Include study characteristics, findings, and citation details for each paper.

output_examples.input: Find recent advances in CRISPR gene editing 2024 with citations
output: Key finding: New base editing techniques achieve 40% higher precision...
1. Liu et al. (2024) Nature Biotechnology - DOI:10.1038/s41587-024-01234

best_practices: Use specific search terms with time filters to get recent, relevant results
Combine simple lookups for literature breadth with reasoning queries for analysis
Verify citations against primary sources before including in manuscripts
anti_patterns: Using overly broad queries like general topic names without specificity
Relying solely on extracted citations without verifying source accessibility
Mixing different research topics in a single query reduces result quality

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for research queries.

faq.question: What models are used for searches?
faq.answer: Perplexity Sonar Pro Search for fast lookups and Sonar Reasoning Pro for complex analysis.

faq.question: How many citations are returned per query?
faq.answer: Typically 5-10 high-quality citations with full bibliographic information and DOI links.

faq.question: Is my research data stored or shared?
faq.answer: Queries are sent to OpenRouter API. Review their privacy policy for data handling details.

faq.question: Why are some expected papers missing?
faq.answer: Very recent papers may not be indexed yet. Paywalled content and specialized databases are not accessible.

faq.question: How is this different from WebSearch?
faq.answer: Research lookup prioritizes academic and peer-reviewed sources with structured citation extraction.
